source: STUB created (fill descriptions from raw template)

positions.label: Setup
positions.title: Set-up
positions.description:
Setup (Address position)
Athletic posture with a neutral spine and slight hip hinge.
Pressure balanced under the feet (often slightly favoring the lead side).
Arms hang naturally; no reaching or crowding.
Clubface square to the intended start line.
Grip and posture you can repeat under pressure.
Purpose: Create a stable, repeatable starting position that doesnâ€™t require timing later.

positions.label: Shaft Parallel (Backswing)
positions.title: Club shaft parallel to the ground in the backswing
positions.description:
Shaft Parallel (Backswing)
Club, hands, and chest move together early (one-piece takeaway).
Shaft parallel to the ground with the clubhead outside the hands or on-plane.
Clubface roughly matches spine angle (not rolled open or shut).
Trail hip begins to load without sway.
Purpose: Establish structure and direction without manipulating the clubface.

positions.label: Lead Arm Parallel (Backswing)
positions.title: Left arm parallel to the ground in backswing
positions.description:
Lead Arm Parallel (Backswing)
Lead arm parallel to the ground with width maintained.
Hands stay in front of the chest (not trapped behind).
Shoulder turn continues while posture stays intact.
Pressure continues loading into the trail side.
Purpose: Build coil and width without losing connection or balance.

positions.label: Top
positions.title: The top of the backswing
positions.description:
Top of Swing
Turn is completed without collapsing the arms.
Lead wrist stable; clubface controlled.
Trail elbow points more down than behind.
Pressure centered or slightly favoring trail side (ready to shift).
Purpose: Reach a top position you can start down from without rerouting.

positions.label: Lead Arm Parallel (Downswing)
positions.title: Left arm parallel to the ground in the downswing
positions.description:
Lead Arm Parallel (Downswing)
Pressure has shifted toward the lead side before the arms drop.
Hips begin opening while the chest stays slightly closed.
Hands work down in front of the body (no over-the-top throw).
Posture maintained; no early stand-up.
Purpose: Sequence the downswing from the ground up.

positions.label: Shaft Parallel (Downswing)
positions.title: Clubshaft parallel to the ground in the downswing
positions.description:
Shaft Parallel (Downswing)
Shaft parallel to the ground with the handle leading the clubhead.
Club approaching from the inside.
Lead wrist flat or slightly bowed (not flipping).
Trail elbow in front of the trail hip.
Majority of pressure now on the lead side.
Purpose: Deliver the club with control, not timing.

positions.label: Impact
positions.title: Impact
positions.description:
Impact
Pressure firmly on the lead side with the lead leg bracing.
Hands ahead of the clubhead (irons).
Clubface square relative to path and start line.
Chest and hips open; posture maintained.
Purpose: Strike the ball first with compression and predictable start direction.

positions.label: Shaft Parallel (Follow-Through)
positions.title: Clubshaft parallel to the ground in the follow through
positions.description:
Shaft Parallel (Follow-Through)
Arms extend through impact.
Body rotation controls the release (not the hands).
Chest continues turning toward the target.
Trail foot releasing naturally.
Purpose: Prove the ball wasnâ€™t hit with a flip.

positions.label: Trail Arm Parallel (Follow-Through)
positions.title: Right arm parallel to the ground in the follow through
positions.description:
Trail Arm Parallel (Follow-Through)
Trail arm extended; club exits left around the body.
Balance fully on the lead side.
Head and torso free to release with rotation.
Speed continues past impact.
Purpose: Confirm full release and rotational control.

positions.label: Finish
positions.title: Finish
positions.description:
Finish
Fully rotated, tall, and balanced.
Weight entirely on the lead side.
Trail foot on the toe.
Finish can be held comfortably.
Purpose: A balanced finish confirms the swing was controlled and repeatable.
